hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) fought the Ghazwa (i.e. battles of Al-Fath during Ramadan." Narrated Az-Zuhri: Ibn Al-Musaiyab (also) said the same. Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما added, "The Prophet (ﷺ) fasted and when he reached Al-Kadid, a place where there is water between Kudaid and 'Usfan, he broke his fast and did not fast afterwards till the whole month had passed away.
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) left Medina (for Mecca) in the company of ten-thousand (Muslim warriors) in (the month of) Ramadan, and that was eight and a half years after his migration to Medina. He and the Muslims who were with him, proceeded on their way to Mecca. He was fasting and they were fasting, but when they reached a place called Al-Kadid which was a place of water between 'Usfan and Kudaid, he broke his fast and so did they. (Az-Zuhri said, "One should take the last action of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and leave his early action (while taking a verdict.")
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) set out towards Hunain in the month of Ramadan and some of the people were fasting while some others were not fasting, and when the Prophet (ﷺ) mounted his she-camel, he asked for a tumbler of milk or water and put it on the palm of his hand or on his she-camel and then the people looked at him; and those who were not fasting told those who were fasting, to break their fast (i.e. as the Prophet (ﷺ) had done so).
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: "The Prophet (ﷺ) went (to Hunain) in the year of the Conquest (of Mecca). Moreover, Hadrat Ibn-e-Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما says that Allah's Apostle ﷺ set out (conquering Makkah Muhammad).
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: "Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) travelled in the month of Ramadan and he fasted till he reached (a place called) 'Usfan, then he asked for a tumbler of water and drank it by the daytime so that the people might see him. He broke his fast till he reached Mecca." Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما used to say, "Allah's Apostle fasted and sometimes did not fast while traveling, so one may fast or may not (on journeys)"
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) set out (towards Mecca) during the year of the Conquest (of Mecca) and this news reached (the infidels of Quraish), Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ , Hakim bin Hizam and Budail bin Warqa came out to gather information about Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) , They proceeded on their way till they reached a place called Marr-az-Zahran (which is near Mecca). Behold! There they saw many fires as if they were the fires of `Arafat. Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ said, "What is this? It looked like the fires of `Arafat." Budail bin Warqa' said, "Banu `Amr are less in number than that." Some of the guards of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saw them and took them over, caught them and brought them to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ embraced Islam. When the Prophet (ﷺ) proceeded, he said to Al-Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ , "Keep Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ standing at the top of the mountain so that he would look at the Muslims. So Al-`Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ kept him standing (at that place) and the tribes with the Prophet (ﷺ) started passing in front of Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ in military batches. A batch passed and Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ said, "O `Abbas Who are these?" `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ said, "They are (Banu) Ghifar." Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ said, I have got nothing to do with Ghifar." Then (a batch of the tribe of) Juhaina passed by and he said similarly as above. Then (a batch of the tribe of) Sa`d bin Huzaim passed by and he said similarly as above. then (Banu) Sulaim passed by and he said similarly as above. Then came a batch, the like of which Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ had not seen. He said, "Who are these?" `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ said, "They are the Ansar headed by Sa`d bin Ubada, the one holding the flag." Sa`d bin Ubada said, "O Abu Sufyan! Today is the day of a great battle and today (what is prohibited in) the Ka`ba will be permissible." Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ said., "O `Abbas! How excellent the day of destruction is! "Then came another batch (of warriors) which was the smallest of all the batches, and in it there was Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and his companions and the flag of the Prophet (ﷺ) was carried by Az-Zubair bin Al Awwam. When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) passed by Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ , the latter said, (to the Prophet), "Do you know what Sa`d bin 'Ubada رضی اللہ عنہ said?" The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "What did he say?" Abu Sufyan رضی اللہ عنہ said, "He said so-and-so." The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Sa`d told a lie, but today Allah will give superiority to the Ka`ba and today the Ka`ba will be covered with a (cloth) covering." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered that his flag be fixed at Al-Hajun. Narrated `Urwa: Nafi` bin Jubair bin Mut`im said, "I heard Al-Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ saying to Az-Zubair bin Al- `Awwam رضی اللہ عنہ , 'O Abu `Abdullah ! Did Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) order you to fix the flag here?' " Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered Khalid bin Al-Walid رضی اللہ عنہ to enter Mecca from its upper part from Ka'da while the Prophet (ﷺ) himself entered from Kuda. Two men from the cavalry of Khalid bin Al-Wahd رضی اللہ عنہ named Hubaish bin Al-Ash'ar and Kurz bin Jabir Al-Fihri were martyred on that day.
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

englishNarrator: Narrated `Abdullah bin Mughaffal رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) on the day of the Conquest of Mecca over his she-camel, reciting Surat-al-Fath in a vibrant quivering tone. (The sub-narrator, Mu'awiya رضی اللہ عنہ added, "Were I not afraid that the people may gather around me, I would recite in vibrant quivering tone as he (i.e. `Abdullah bin Mughaffal رضی اللہ عنہ) did, imitating Allah's Messenger (ﷺ).")
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

englishNarrator: Narrated Usama bin Zaid رضی اللہ عنہما :
hadithEnglish: During the Conquest (of Mecca), "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! Where will we encamp tomorrow?" The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "But has `Aqil left for us any house to lodge in?" He then added, "No believer will inherit an infidel's property, and no infidel will inherit the property of a believer." Az- Zuhri was asked, "Who inherited Abu Talib?" Az-Zuhri replied, "Aqeel and Talib inherited him." Mamar has reported from Zuhri: It was the time of Hajj when it was asked: Where will we stay tomorrow? Whereas the report of Younus, mention neither Hajj nor the Conquest if Makkah.
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

englishNarrator: Narrated Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "If Allah makes us victorious, our encamping place will be Al-Khaif, the place where the infidels took an oath to be loyal to Heathenism (by boycotting Banu Hashim, the Prophet's folk).
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

englishNarrator: Narrated Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) intended to carry on the Ghazwa of Hunain, he said, "Tomorrow, if Allah wished, our encamping) plaice will be Khaif Bani Kinana where (the infidels) took an oath to be loyal to Heathenism."
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

englishNarrator: Narrated Anas bin Malik رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: On the day of the Conquest, the Prophet (ﷺ) entered Mecca, wearing a helmet on his head. When he took it off, a man came and said, "Ibn Khatal is clinging to the curtain of the Ka`ba." The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Kill him." (Malik a sub-narrator said, "On that day the Prophet (ﷺ) was not in a state of Ihram as it appeared to us, and Allah knows better.")
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: When the Prophet (ﷺ) entered Mecca on the day of the Conquest, there were 360 idols around the Ka`ba. The Prophet (ﷺ) started striking them with a stick he had in his hand and was saying, "Truth has come and Falsehood will neither start nor will it reappear. And: ''the truth has come falsehood neither originates nor be restored.''
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) arrived in Mecca, he refused to enter the Ka`ba while there were idols in it. So he ordered that they be taken out. The pictures of the (Prophets) Abraham and Ishmael, holding arrows of divination in their hands, were carried out. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "May Allah ruin them (i.e. the infidels) for they knew very well that they (i.e. Abraham and Ishmael) never drew lots by these (divination arrows). Then the Prophet (ﷺ) entered the Ka`ba and said. "Allahu Akbar" in all its directions and came out and not offer any prayer therein. Mamar has also reported the same from Ayyub. And Wohaib said: Ayyub has narrated it to us from Ikrimah and he from the prophet (ﷺ) .
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) entered Makkah through its upper part and he was riding his she-camel. Usãma bin Zaid رضی اللہ عنہما was his Companion-rider behind him (on the same she-camel). In his company were Bilãl رضی اللہ عنہ and 'Uthmãn bin Talha رضی اللہ عنہ , who was one of the Al-Hajabah (who keep the key of the gate of the Ka'bah). When he made his she-camel kneel down in the Mosque (i.e., Al-Masjid al-Haram), he ordered him (i.e., 'Uthman) to bring the key of the Ka'bah. Then Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) entered the Ka'bah along with 'Usãma bin Zaid, Bilãl and 'Uthmãn bin Talha رضی اللہ عنہ , and he stayed in it for a long period and then came out. The people rushed (to get in) and `Abdullãh bin 'Umar رضی اللہ عنہما was the first to enter and he found Bilãl رضی اللہ عنہ standing behind the door. Ibn `Umar asked Bilãl, "Where did Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) offer the Salat (prayer)?" Bilãl showed him the place where he (ﷺ) had offered Salat (prayer). `Abdullah رضی اللہ عنہما later on said, "I forgot to ask Bilãl how many prostrations (i.e., Rak'a) the Prophet offered."
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: During the year of the Conquest (of Mecca), the Prophet (ﷺ) entered Mecca through Kada which was at the upper part of Mecca. This tradition is followed by Abu Osama and Wahib with the mention of Kada.
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: During the year of the Conquest (of Mecca), the Prophet (ﷺ) entered Mecca through its upper part through Kada.
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

englishNarrator: Narrated Um Hani رضی اللہ عنہا :
hadithEnglish: None informed us that he saw the Prophet (ﷺ) offering the Duha (i.e. forenoon) prayer, except Um Hani رضی اللہ عنہا who mentioned that the Prophet (ﷺ) took a bath in her house on the day of the Conquest (of Mecca) and then offered an eight rak`at prayer. She added, "I never saw the Prophet (ﷺ) offering a lighter prayer than that prayer, but he was performing perfect bowing and prostrations."
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say in his bowings and prostrations, "Subhanaka Allahumma Rabbanã wa bihamdika, Allãhumma ighfirli" (Glorified be You, O Allah, our Lord! All the praises are for You. O Allah, forgive me)!"
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ used to admit me (into his house) along with the old men who had fought in the Badr battle. Some of them said (to `Umar), "Why do you allow this young man to enter with us, while we have sons of his own age? " `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ said, "You know what person he is." One day `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ called them and called me along with them, I had thought he called me on that day to show them something about me (i.e. my knowledge). `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ asked them, "What do you say about (the Sura): "When comes the help of Allah and the Conquest (of Mecca) And you see mankind entering the Religion of Allah (i.e. Islam) in crowds. 'So celebrate the Praises Of your Lord and ask for His forgiveness, Truly, He is the One Who accepts repentance and forgives." (110.1-3) Some of them replied, "We are ordered to praise Allah and repent to Him if we are helped and granted victory." Some said, "We do not know." Others kept quiet. `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ then said to me, "Do you say similarly?" I said, "No." `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ said "What do you say then?" I said, "This Verse indicates the approaching of the death of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) of which Allah informed him. When comes the help of Allah and the Conquest, i.e. the Conquest of Mecca, that will be the sign of your Prophet's) approaching death, so testify the uniqueness of your Lord (i.e. Allah) and praise Him and repent to Him as He is ready to forgive." On that, `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ said, "I do not know about it anything other than what you know."
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

englishNarrator: Narrated Abu Shuraih رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: `Amr bin Sa`id while the latter was sending troops in batches to Mecca, "O chief! Allow me to tell you a statement which Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said on the second day of the Conquest of Mecca. My two ears heard it and my heart remembered it and my two eyes saw him when he said it. He (i.e. the Prophet) praised Allah and then said, 'Mecca has been made a sanctuary by Allah and not by the people, so it is not lawful for a person, who believes in Allah and the Last Day to shed blood in it, or to cut its trees and if someone asks the permission to fight in Mecca because Allah's Apostle was allowed to fight in it, say to him; Allah permitted His Apostle and did not allow you, and even he (i.e. the Apostle) was allowed for a short period of the day, and today its (Mecca's sanctity has become the same as it was before (of old) so those who are present should inform those who are absent (this Hadith)." Then Abu Shuraih, was asked, "What did `Amr say to you? Abu Shuraih said, "He said, "I knew that better than you, O Abu Shuraih! The Haram (i.e. Mecca) does not give refuge to a sinner or a fleeing murderer or a person running away after causing destruction."
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

englishNarrator: Narrated Jabir bin `Abdullah رضی اللہ عنہما :
hadithEnglish: He heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying in the year of the Conquest (of Mecca) while he was in Mecca, "Allah and His Apostle have made the selling of wine (i.e. alcoholic drinks) unlawful."
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: We stayed (in Mecca) for ten days along with the Prophet (ﷺ) and used to offer shortened prayers (i.e. journey prayers).
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) stayed in Mecca for 19 days during which he prayed 2 rak`at in each prayer.
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

hadithEnglish: "We stayed for 19 days with Prophet on a journey during which we used to offer shortened prayers." Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما added, "We offer the Qasr prayer (i.e. shortened prayer) If we stay up to 19 days as travelers, But if we stay longer, we offer complete prayers.
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)

englishNarrator: Narrated `Abdullah bin Tha`laba bin Su`air رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: whose face was rubbed by the Prophet during the year of the Conquest (of Makkah).
chapterEnglish: Military Expeditions led by the Prophet (PBUH) (Al-Maghaazi)
